scoring_rule: Each problem: ALL words must be correct. Level: 80% of problems must pass.

problems.prompt:
# Syllable Puzzle

Find 11 words using the syllables from the bank.
Each syllable is used exactly once (extras are distractors).

## Syllable Bank
sau, lighter, nos, li, ized, high, ince, comb, prog, de, ing, jew, coached, cen, pub, nas, moor, tic, prs, ynx, ings, or, can, tral

## Clues
A. (2 syllables) — A wager consisting essentially of three separate bets, for the best score on each of the front nine (holes 1–9), back nine (holes 10–18), and total 18 holes.
B. (2 syllables) — straighten with a comb
C. (3 syllables) — the keeper of a public house
D. (2 syllables) — A marker pen used to highlight text.
E. (1 syllables) — a soft yellowish-white trivalent metallic element of the rare earth group; can be recovered from bastnasite or monazite by an ion-exchange process
F. (1 syllables) — a person belonging to the worldwide group claiming descent from Jacob (or converted to it) and connected by cultural or religious ties
G. (2 syllables) — a place where a craft can be made fast
H. (3 syllables) — a sign of something about to happen
I. (1 syllables) — drive a coach
J. (4 syllables) — not centralized; having no center or several centers
K. (1 syllables) — The gold [masked] yellow tincture on a coat of arms.

## Answer Format
Return JSON: {"answers": ["WORD1", "WORD2", ...]}
Words must be UPPERCASE and in clue order.
